intro: Solena sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in woodland or rocky areas. Solena sinensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine.
